contentrichtext.text: {{primarysources|date=February 2008}} {{Infobox political party | country = the Netherlands | colorcode = {{Dutch politics/party colours|VVD}} | party_name = Europe Transparent | native_name = {{lang|nl|Europa Transparant}} | party_logo = | leader = [[Paul van Buitenen]] | chairman = | leader1_title = Leader in the Senate | leader1_name = | leader2_title = Leader in the House of Representatives | leader2_name = | leader3_title = Leader in the European Parliament | leader3_name = [[Paul van Buitenen]] | foundation = {{Start date|2004|04|08|df=y}} | merger = | split = | dissolved = {{End date|2008}} | merged = | seats1_title = [[Senate of the Netherlands|Seats in the Senate]] | seats1 = | seats2_title = [[House of Representatives of the Netherlands|Seats in the House of Representatives]] | seats2 = | seats3_title = Seats in the European Parliament | seats3 = <timeline> ImageSize = width:100 height:25 PlotArea = left:0 bottom:0 top:0 right:0 TimeAxis = orientation:horizontal format:yyyy DateFormat = x.y Period = from:0 till:27 TimeAxis = orientation:horizontal AlignBars = early Colors = id:gray value:rgb(0.85,0.85,0.85) id:darkgray value:rgb(0.27,0.27,0.27) id:midgray value:rgb(0.57,0.57,0.57) id:blue value:rgb(0.07, 0.44, 0.76) id:green value:rgb(0.38, 0.73, 0.27) id:orange value:rgb(1, 0.55, 0) id:red value:rgb(0.80,0, 0) BarData = bar:Wikipedias PlotData= bar:Wikipedias from:0 till:25 color:gray width:0.2in text:/25 bar:Wikipedias from:0 till:0 color:red width:0.2in text:0 </timeline> | ideology = Anti-Corruption | position = N/A | religion = | youth_wing = | wing1_title = Thinktank | wing1 = | international = | european = | europarl = [[EGP/EFA]] | colours = | headquarters = | website = {{URL|europatransparant.nl}} }} '''Europe Transparent''' ({{lang-nl|Europa Transparant}}) was a [[political party]] in the [[Netherlands]]. The founder of the party, [[Paul van Buitenen]], announced the party's establishment on 8 April 2004. In the [[European Parliament election, 2004|2004 election]] to the [[European Parliament]] the party gained two seats, after a campaign that cost no more than €4,000.{{Fact|date=September 2011}} Van Buitenen and the number two on the list, [[Els de Groen]], who has written about [[Political corruption|corruption]] scandals in [[Eastern Europe]], have joined the [[European Greens - European Free Alliance|European Greens–European Free Alliance]] [[European Parliament party groups|party group]] as independent members. The party was claiming{{Fact|date=September 2011}} to be non-ideological: they aimed to fight for{{Fact|date=September 2011}} more open European government, against [[fraud]], corruption and favouring of friends. Because the pursuit of this goal was their primary occupation, they participated only to a limited extent in the normal system of debates, reports, meetings, etc. Their ultimate goal is to be able to disband themselves when they have made the [[European Union]] transparent.{{Fact|date=September 2011}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.europatransparant.nl/ Official website] {{nl icon}} {{Dutch Political Parties}} [[Category:Political parties in the Netherlands]] [[Category:Anti-corruption parties]] [[Category:Political parties established in 2004]] [[Category:Political parties disestablished in 2008]] [[Category:Europe Transparent MEPs|*Main]]
